hypothesis_content.title: Stress-to-Neutral Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, when BTC 10-day realized volatility falls below 50% after being >80% for ≥3 days, and BTC price breaks above the 5-day consolidation range high with ≥5% volume spike, the regime transitions to NEUTRAL within 3 days with >70% probability, favoring long BTC/short ETH pairs.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression after stress periods indicates selling exhaustion. BTC leadership over ETH during recovery suggests quality flight before broad market normalization. Historical stress exits often begin with BTC outperformance.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day realized volatility drops from >80% to <50%
BTC breaks above 5-day price range high on ≥5% volume increase vs 20-day avg

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC/ETH pair gains 8% OR regime shifts to NEUTRAL (confidence ≥65%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC retraces below consolidation range low
exit_conditions.time_exit: 3 trading days without regime transition to NEUTRAL

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility compression occurs but regime remains STRESS or deteriorates to BEAR, OR ETH outperforms BTC during transition attempt.
